page.title: 14WIRRAL WAY. NESTON
page.content: The Wirral Way is a pleasant tree lined pathway stretching from West Kirby to Hooton.It is twelve miles long and consists of a horse track and footpath with lovely views over the Dee Estuary to North Wales.It used to be a single track railway for steam trains.Most of the people we interviewed use the Wirral Way and most use it on foot rather than on horseback.The majority of people use it less than once a week.Both locals and visitors use the Wirral Way for exercise and also exercising their dogs, although some locals use it mainly as a short cut.Dog owners say it is handy because their dogs are able to roam free from the danger of traffic.The Wirral Way can be used for nature walks especially by local school children.
